name: Travelodge Chessington Tolworth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in quite a few Travelodges of varying standards and this was definitely on the low end of the scale.
reviews.title: Average for a Travelodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is basically in a converted office tower block and is behind the M&S (by far the easiest way to get there is to drive all the way down Ewell Road, past the M&S which will be on your left, then left at the roundabout and left again). You have to use the parking in the multi-storey carpark next door which is quite grim and you can't get 24h tickets.
reviews.title: Good room but the staff couldn't understand English

reviews.text: The hotel itself seems very depressed. Our room was perfectly clean but everywhere seemed dark and a little dank. We got the goods lift more than the passenger ones as they tok so long to come. The room was a decent enough size but as it was on floor 5 it was at the exact same level as the top of the carpark. Not a problem except for when you're lazing in bed and people are walking past your window!
reviews.title: Basic, with a capital 'B'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only stayed here to attend a wedding nearby so it was fine from that perspective but wouldn't return in a hurry. However, I slept alright and I could afford to stay there so can't really complain, especially as we are talking about Travelodge at the end of the day.
reviews.title: Serves the purpose

reviews.text: For a travelodge the room here was nice, big bed, large sofa and all nice and clean. The lifts were crappy, took an age, we ended up always using the stairs. The problem was the staff's lack of understanding or speaking of English, the official handwritten notices were terribly written and made very little sense. Does the job just don't try and ask any questions.
reviews.title: not worth the money!!!

reviews.text: Far from central London, though excellent for Hampton Court Palace (if you have a car). Rooms were clean and basic(as expected), however, were extremely hot as London was having a heat wave. it was very cheap and suited our purposes to be out of central london with easy train access.
reviews.title: basic rooms at cheap price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can get this hotel at a very cheap rate then it is ok but I would begrudge paying full price. Very vey dated decor and layout. Room basic but sufficient. Ok for a few hours sleep. Car park has a very dodgy feel to it in the evenings with a large group of Chavs having around. Breakfast was ok, man working very hard to clean tables, book people in and cook breakfast. Would not like to spend more than a few hours here.
reviews.title: About what I expected

reviews.text: My collegue travelled from Italy on Business to stay in this hotel. I would not have chosed this in the first place, but with the company having a rediculously low budget for business travel and this being the only place near enough to the office, this is what we used.
reviews.title: Absolutely disgraceful behaviour from this hotel !!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The same collegue stayed in this same hotel 2 weeks ago, but not this time...
reviews.title: Filthy - Never again

reviews.text: He arrived at the Travel lodge in the early hours of the morning after his flight had been delayed, a bad enuogh start. He had with him the booking receipt from the company, which is all that has ever been needed in any hotel any of our collegues have ever stayed in before, including at this hotel ! The booking was fully paid in advance, he had the receipt.
reviews.title: "Never again"

reviews.text: Had booked online, 2 rooms for 2 adults and 3 children, paid extra for 5 x breakfast and 5 x dinner, confirmed on email confirmation. On arrival stated only 2 breakfast and 2 dinners booked. Had to fight for extra meals, despite having confirmation email with all extras listed as paid for. Apart from that hotel was clean, room clean but no light working in bathroom which had no windows. Was a cheap online promotion, but appears web site not set up to deal with all extras and pass it on to actual hotel. In the end managed to have the meals, and were ok.
reviews.title: Booking system a nightmare, what we booked was not what we had, had to fight for what booked.

reviews.text: I know I shouldn't complain about this hotel,as my company paid for my stay..but I want to warn others who might be considering paying for a stay at this hotel.....DON'T!
reviews.title: THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN.
You know what to expect when you book Travelodge
reviews.text: We were exhausted on arrival and had to queue at reception for our cold welcome.
The rooms were bare and semi furnished and smelt and felt like a public toilet.
reviews.title: Dirty!

reviews.text: A typical travel lodge...Dirty, tired and lacking basic ammenties. I only stayed here because other hotels in the area were booked out due to the derby. Never again.
reviews.title: Not the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, but the lesser were in war zones!
Don't waste your money
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as we were visiting chessington world, it is close to the train station and in a convenient location. We arrived late at night and the area looked pretty dodgy, I wouldn't have like to walk there alone. Check in was slow as the guy on the desk spoke poor english and couldnt really be bothered. The room was dirty, the pull out bed was covered in stains as were the carpets, the bathroom was not particularly clean either and when I pulled out the spare duvet it became apparent that someone had urinated on it an folded it back up so they obviously hadn't changed it. I complained to the person on the desk but he didn't seem too bothered, he then told me there would be a half hour wait for someone to get a clean one, it was already close to 10 and we wanted to get some sleep so I made a point that it was unacceptable that it had happened and even more unnacceptable that they were not rushing to rectify the situation and he reluctantly found me a clean one. The breakfast was poor and there was not much of a selection. We paid £34 inc breakfast so i didn't expect it to be amazing but I expected it to be clean. I would never stay here again and would much rather pay extra and stay in the chessington holiday inn hotel.
We just needed somewhere to stay the night before a funeral. Picked this travelodge as it was closeby to where we needed to be. I've never stayed in one before so didn;t know what to expect.
reviews.title: Awful, Awful, Awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was easy. Got the lift to the room and it had no linen. There are no phones so we had to go down to the reception and ask for duvets and pillows and towels. We were told to wait and then had to take them up and make the bed ourselves. The pull out bed was a mattress on wheels shoved under the sofa.
reviews.title: Cheap but run down

reviews.text: There was no hairdryer in the room so went back to reception to ask for one, they only has 2 between the entire hotel and they were both out.
reviews.title: Absolutely disgusting

reviews.text: We have previously stayed in Travelodges, but to say that this was by far the worst is an understatement. We booked Tolworth as we were visiting Chessington World of Adventures and family, and felt that the £100+ being asked by Premier Inn was excessive, but on reflection, might have actually been worth the money. We booked a family room for 2 adults & a teenager. On arrival, the car parking signage was confusing, but that was only the start of the problems. I won't dwell on them too much, suffice to say that 1) The room was poorly decorated (you could see where the walls had been touched up with completely different colours) damp around the partially double glazed windows. Bedding was sparse, dirty and wafer thin pillows (1 each!) does not bode well for a good nights rest. Insufficient towels for 3 people to have showers. Wall partioning was so thin, we could hear hammering on a door further down the corridor. Would not stay there again if they were giving the rooms away for free. Overall, it gave the impression of an carpeted dosshouse.
reviews.title: Travelodge?? More like a dosshouse

reviews.text: I have never been so disgusted by the state of a room, it was filthy, the sofa and chair were so stained and dirty you didn't even want to touch them let alone sit on them in your clothes or use the pull out bed section of the sofa. The edges of the carpet clearly hadn’t been hovered in months, the bathroom had mould stains, the shower curtain was discoloured, stained and mouldy at the bottom. The bed was so old and lumpy I was sure I would wake up with a mattress spring stabbing through me.The whole hotel stank and had no real facilities. Unfortunately there were no available rooms in other hotels nearby and we were stuck!
reviews.title: Do Not Stay here

reviews.text: i have stayed in two other Traveloge's and so guess I should have known better, but it was a bit of a last minute booking.
reviews.title: Never ever staying in a Travelodge again.

reviews.text: Room stank of smoke. I should of asked for another but felt they would probably be the same!
reviews.title: Avoid it at all costs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The quality of the rooms and feel of the hotel is very depressing. It feels more like an open prison than a welcoming hotel.
reviews.title: It's not that bad - just don't expect too much!

reviews.text: Stayed overnight for Gatwick. Good location but don't expect a quite night - busy roads on both sides of the hotel. Bathroom light didn't work. A panel in the secondary glazing was missing. Sofa bed not set up. No quilt cover. No bedding for sofa bed. Only two cups when the room was booked for three. Charged £5 for parking only to be blocked in by a regular delivery wagon and then told the car park next door was free. When the receptionist had to visit our room he had to lock up the hotel because he was on his own! All in all, a terrible place.
reviews.title: Basement category!

reviews.text: I stay here quite a lot. They do some good deals. One time I paid £9 a night so stayed the whole week. Easy to get to location. You get the usual problems with the keycards not working half the time and I have noticed a fag packet has been on top of the fire exit door for over a year but apart from that the rooms are clean and I have always done what I needed to do during the day and just used the room to sleep without any hassles
reviews.title: Nice Place :)

reviews.text: This is not the first time I have stayed at this Travelodge, and I have several more nights booked for July. This IS NOT a 5 Star hotel, but it is a spotless and comfortable place to stay 17 miles outside London. Fast and slow rail lines are colse at Surbiton with trains to London every 10 minutes, Tolworth has a train every 30 minutes that stops at every station and is walking distance from the Travelodge. Busses stop on both sides of the hotel with the destinations of Surbiton & Kingston minutes away.
reviews.title: Great Budget Hotel

reviews.text: Every time I have stayed the reception staff have been happy to assist with little extras like more pillows, iron etc. Parking is £5 a night. I have not uses the cafe within the hotel, but there is quite a choice in the local area.
reviews.title: THE WORST HOTEL EVER!!

reviews.text: Having Marks & Spencer underneath the hotel is also helpful for snacks and other items from their huge range of prepared foods.
reviews.title: Fit for Purpose

aka: Travelodge Chessington Tolworth Hotel Kingston Upon Thames
